answers.answer: Any major pancreatic issue is very likely to cause some liver enzyme elevations. In particular, your bilirubin and ALP levels. Let your doctors do their thing and try not to worry, I know though, it's easier said than done.

Thanks for your response.  My Bili level was 0.3, ALP was 62.  My AST 46, and ALT 81.  The AST and ALT were barely elevated.  That was two months ago though, as were my pancreatic enzymes...I still think however if I had a major pancreatic issue, even then they would have been out of whack.. just worried...for the last three days I have been bloated and nauseated around the clock..will see MD on Tuesday.

Thanks for your response.  My Bili level was 0.3, ALP was 62.  My AST 46, and ALT 81.  The AST and ALT were barely elevated.  That was two months ago though, as were my pancreatic enzymes...I still think however if I had a major pancreatic issue, even then they would have been out of whack.. just worried...for the last three days I have been bloated and nauseated around the clock..will see MD on Tuesday.

question: I am 49 male. Overweight. 250lbs.  Diagnosed type 2 diabetic 2.5 years ago.  I have been feeling fine until about a month ago.  I had severe bloating and burning to abdomen.  Went to see doctor who did a complete panel including liver and pancreas enzymes.  All normal, except h pylori which was positive. Took ten day regimen of the tetracycline/bismouth combination.  Felt fine until about two weeks ago.  Began having burning to stomach and fullness also pain to left side and upper back.  Prescribed protonix 40mg BID. Burning gone.  Fullness gone.  Pain to left side and left upper back still present and actually a little worse. I have no abdominal pain whatsoever. Every once in a while a little cramp to left side.  I do have a decrease in appetite although that has to do with concern over the problem.  I have lost weight, but I have been trying, so it's hard to tell if there is a correlation.  Seeing my doc again on Tuesday.  I f my amylase and lipase as well as liver enzymes were normal a month ago, could this be pancreatic in nature?  I am worried because of my diabetes diagnosis 2.5 years ag and no family history.  Just very scared and nervous.  Essentially, no issues except side and back pain
title: pancreas issue? Pancreas Cancer?
